org.jetel.hadoop.service.mapreduce

Interface HadoopJobReporter


  • public interface HadoopJobReporter

    Defines a service for obtaining information about Hadoop map/reduce job that is/was executed on Hadoop cluster. Information is typically obtained by communication with the Hadoop cluster (specifically it is obtained from jobtracker). The job that is to be reported about might be still in progress (in which case tracking information are obtained) or execution of the job might already be completed (see method isComplete()). In later case result information are obtained.

    This interface specifies methods for obtaining information about the job provided by Hadoop API. Therefore, implementors are typically wrappers around Hadoop API class. This interface provides abstraction from Hadoop specific API that may differ between Hadoop versions.

    Since:
    rel-3-4-0-M2
    See Also:
    HadoopMapReduceService.sendJob(HadoopMapReduceJob, Properties)

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Gets identification of the job.
        Returns:
        Unique identification of the job assigned by Hadoop cluster.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets job name.
        Returns:
        Identification (label) of the job assigned by user before sending the job to cluster. This might not be unique.

      • setupProgress

        float setupProgress()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Gets progress of setup phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Progress of the setup phase of map/reduce job as number belonging to interval 0 (inclusive) to 1 (inclusive). Returns 0 if setup phase did not start yet and 1 if the phase has completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails.

      • mapProgress

        float mapProgress()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Gets progress of map phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Progress of the map phase of map/reduce job as number belonging to interval 0 (inclusive) to 1 (inclusive). Returns 0 if map phase did not start yet and 1 if the phase has completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails.

      • reduceProgress

        float reduceProgress()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Gets progress of reduce phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Progress of the reduce phase of map/reduce job as number belonging to interval 0 (inclusive) to 1 (inclusive). Returns 0 if reduce phase did not start yet and 1 if the phase has completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails.

      • cleanUpProgress

        float cleanUpProgress()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Gets progress of cleanup phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Progress of the cleanup phase of map/reduce job as number belonging to interval 0 (inclusive) to 1 (inclusive). Returns 0 if cleanup phase did not start yet and 1 if the phase has completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails.

      • getJobState

        java.lang.String getJobState()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Gets state of the job as provided by jobtracker.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with the jobtracker of the cluster fails.

      • isComplete

        boolean isComplete()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Indicates that the job has completed.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the job is has finished. It might or might not be successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails during call to this method.
        See Also:
        isSuccessful()

      • isSuccessful

        boolean isSuccessful()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Indicates whether the job was successful.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the map/reduce job is completed and it finished successfully.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with the jobtracker of the cluster fails or the job itself fails during call to this method.
        See Also:
        isComplete()

      • getFailureInfo

        java.lang.String getFailureInfo()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        In case that map/reduce job has finished but it was not successful this method can be used to obtain gailure info. It can be used to debug definition of mapper, reducer or other parts of the job definition.
        Returns:
        In case of job failure information about the failure or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails.

      • kill

        void kill()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to kill Hadoop map/reduce job. If call to this method succeeds callers should assume that the job has either finished or it was stopped by that call. In both cases the job is not being executed any more.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or there is an exception while killing the job.

      • getCounterValue

        long getCounterValue(HadoopCounterKey counterKey)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        For given Hadoop map/reduce counter key representation gets value of counter represented for this job.
        Parameters:
        counterKey - Hadoop API independent representation of Hadoop map/reduce counter key.
        Returns:
        Value of specified counter.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with jobtracker of the cluster fails or counter value cannot be obtained by jobtracker.
        See Also:
        HadoopMapReduceInfoService.getCounterGroups(), HadoopCounterGroup

      • getAllCounters

        java.util.List<HadoopCounterKeyValuePair> getAllCounters()
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Gets all counters as list of keys and respective values.
        Returns:
        A list of all map/reduce counters (including user defined and predefined) as key-value pairs.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication with the jobtracker fails of it fails to obtain value of counters.
